name: Fast Freddie
overview:
Fast Freddie is a 2D side-scrolling game that scrolls from left to right rather than right to left. You are Freddie, flying in a hang glider with the goal to make it to the end of the level, kicking balloons, helicopters, birds, targets, etc. along the way.

In this game you attempt to guide your hang-glider to the end of the stage. In doing so, you must take care to avoid various flying obstacles that attempt to prevent you from reaching your goal. At your disposal is your trusty kick that you can use to take out enemies coming from below. In addition to scoring points for how long you survive, you can also collect five letters in each stage that spell B-O-N-U-S for an end of level point bonus.

Game was licensed to Atari by Kaneko in 1982.

The game was originally called Fly-Boy in Japan.
